info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 2:40PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern McMullen, northwestern Live Oak and northwestern Bee Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 239 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Nell, or 11 miles east of Campbellton, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Three Rivers, Choke Canyon, Calliham, Nell, Karon, Oakville, Crowther, Pawnee, Ray Point, Whitsett and Esseville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 37 between mile markers 60 and 83. US Highway 281 between mile markers 618 and 624. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
